CsGL.Util
Class Keyboard

System.Object
   |
   +--OSLib
         |
         +--Keyboard
   in Keyboard.cs
class Keyboard
extends OSLib

This class gather information about keyboard state. unlike OnKeySomething method they are accurate and could be accessed from anywhere in the application (not only from a Control).

the bool[] array returned by some function contain the state (pressed or not of the key) you use it like this:
  bool isPScreen = Keyboard.GetKeysState()[(int)Keys.Snapshot], or
  bool isPScreen = Keyboard.IsKeyPressed(Keys.Snapshot)

The static methods IsKeyPressed & GetKeysState could safely be assumed to be portable. I am not sure of the same for instance and AddListener methods. but they require less calculation than GetKeysState(). Beside some key are incorrectly reported in Keyboard instances and in the hook

See Also:
Hook

GetKeysState

public static bool[] GetKeysState();
return an array of bool wich is true if the given key is pressed.

GetKeysState

public unsafe static void GetKeysState( bool[] state );
take an array of bool[256]. fill it with a boolean stating if the given virtual key is pressed or not.
to know if a given key is pressed just do that:

Hook

public delegate void Hook( Keyboard.Event e );
call this callback function anytime a key event occur. some key doesn't work very well, like PrintScreen which is called only on KeyUp.... but IsKeyPressed give accurate values

IsKeyPressed

public static extern bool IsKeyPressed( Keys k );

KeyStateChanged

public virtual void KeyStateChanged( Keyboard.Event e );
override this method to do something after a key event. could be a right place to test KeyUp on PrintScreen key...

RemoveListener

public static void RemoveListener( Hook fct );

Reset

public void Reset();
usefull if your application lost focus. call it every time after a gain focus..
